Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

>
> Message: 23
> Date: Mon, 12 Aug 2002 09:08:21 EDT
> From: Dnowens@...
> Subject: Re: Re; 2226 -- Ned AGREES with Sandra AGAIN
>
> In a message dated 8/12/02 4:00:18 AM Central Daylight Time,
> nedvare@... writes:
>
>
>> Ned says:
>>
>> I agree. And so has (does) my state, CT, big. We read about abuse, injuries,
>> neglect, yes - killing, almost every week, and this, even though we know
>> that the agencies, just like the schools, do whatever they can to hide their
>> dysfunctions. No one is punished, no one is blamed. Why? It's the state.
>> Private agencies are closed when they do the same things. Charges are filed.
>>
>> Homeschool those kids. Keep them healthy, safe. Nobody else will.
>>
>
> If the parents are abusing and neglectful, why on earth would homeschooling
> keep them safe? I would think that in this situation, school would keep them
> safe. School certainly kept me safe. But what do I know?
> ~Nancy

To Nancy,

The subject was, as I remember, state child/family agencies that abuse,
neglect, and even kill children, and then change their names to help the
public forget which agencies were responsible, and so the state will
continue to fund them.

The connection I was making was that both the social agencies and the
schools try to hide their cruelties.

I don't disagree that some schools are safer than some homes. That sad fact,
however, doesn't give the state the right to take all children from their
parents and put them in schools, as much as some people would like to see
that.

Ned Vare
Education is a state-controlled manufactory of echoes. --Norman Douglas
